item.title: Understanding Q-Q Plots
item.description: The Q-Q plot, or quantile-quantile plot, is a graphical tool to help us assess if a set of data plausibly came from some theoretical distribution such as a Normal or exponential. For example, if we run a statistical analysis that assumes our dependent variable is Normally distributed, we can use a Normal Q-Q plot to check that assumption. Itâ€™s just a visual check, not an air-tight proof, so it is somewhat subjective.
